subsection.content:

subsection.heading: Heads of households
subsection.content: There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every head of a household (as defined in section 2(b)) a tax determined in accordance with the following table.

subsection.heading: Unmarried individuals (other than surviving spouses and heads of households)
subsection.content: There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every individual (other than a surviving spouse as defined in section 2(a) or the head of a household as defined in section 2(b)) who is not a married individual (as defined in section 7703) a tax determined in accordance with the following table.

subsection.heading: Married individuals filing separate returns
subsection.content: There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every married individual (as defined in section 7703) who does not make a single return jointly with his spouse under section 6013, a tax determined in accordance with the following table.

subsection.heading: Estates and trusts
subsection.content: There is hereby imposed on the taxable income of every estate and trust taxable under this subsection a tax determined in accordance with the following table.

subsection.heading: Adjustments in tax tables so that inflation will not result in tax increases
subsection.content: The Secretary shall prescribe tables which shall apply in lieu of the tables contained in subsections (a), (b), (c), (d), and (e) with respect to taxable years beginning in a calendar year after 1993.

subsection.heading: Certain unearned income of children taxed as if parent's income
subsection.content: In the case of any child to whom this subsection applies, the tax imposed by this section shall be equal to the greater of the tax imposed under paragraph (1) or the sum of the tax that would be imposed under this section if the child's net unearned income were not taken into account.

subsection.heading: Maximum capital gains rate
subsection.content: If a taxpayer has a net capital gain for any taxable year, the tax imposed by this section for such taxable year shall not exceed the sum determined under paragraph (1), subject to the provisions of section 1(h)(11) regarding qualified dividend income.

subsection.heading: Definition of surviving spouse
subsection.content: For purposes of section 1, the term "surviving spouse" means a taxpayer whose spouse died during either of the two taxable years immediately preceding the taxable year, and who maintains as his home a household which constitutes for the taxable year the principal place of abode (as a member of such household) of a dependent.

subsection.heading: Definition of head of household
subsection.content: For purposes of this subtitle, an individual shall be considered a head of a household if, and only if, such individual is not married at the close of his taxable year, is not a surviving spouse (as defined in subsection (a)), and maintains as his home a household which constitutes for more than one-half of such taxable year the principal place of abode.

subsection.heading: Certain married individuals living apart
subsection.content: For purposes of this part, an individual shall be treated as not married at the close of the taxable year if such individual is so treated under the provisions of section 7703(b).

section.heading: Cross references relating to tax on individuals
section.content: For rates of tax on nonresident aliens, see section 871. For doubling of tax on citizens of certain foreign countries, see section 891. For rate of withholding in case of nonresident aliens, see section 1441. For tax on income of estates and trusts, see section 641.

subsection.heading: Corporations in general
subsection.content: A tax is hereby imposed for each taxable year on the taxable income of every corporation. The amount of the tax imposed by subsection (a) shall be 21 percent of taxable income.

subsection.heading: Qualified personal service corporations
subsection.content: In the case of a qualified personal service corporation (as defined in section 448(d)(2)), the tax imposed by subsection (a) shall be computed by applying a rate of 21 percent.

section.content: [Repealed. Pub. L. 115-97, title I, Sec. 13001(b)(1), Dec. 22, 2017, 131 Stat. 2096]

part.heading: Changes in Rates During a Taxable Year

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: If any rate of tax imposed by this chapter changes, and if the taxable year includes the effective date of the change (unless that date is the first day of the taxable year), then the tax under this chapter for the taxable year shall be computed in accordance with regulations prescribed by the Secretary.

subsection.heading: Section inapplicable to certain changes
subsection.content: This section shall not apply to any change in rate provided under section 1(f), 1(j), 32(b)(3), 41(h), 42(b)(2), 68(b)(2), 911(b)(2)(D)(ii), or 7872(e)(2).

section.heading: Expenses for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an individual for which there are 1 or more qualifying individuals (as defined in subsection (b)(1)) with respect to such individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of the employment-related expenses (as defined in subsection (b)(2)) paid by such individual during the taxable year.

subsection.heading: Definitions of qualifying individual and employment-related expenses

paragraph.heading: Qualifying individual
paragraph.content: The term "qualifying individual" means a dependent of the taxpayer (as defined in section 152(a)(1)) who has not attained age 13.

paragraph.heading: Employment-related expenses
paragraph.content: The term "employment-related expenses" means amounts paid for household services and for the care of a qualifying individual but only if such amounts are incurred to enable the taxpayer to be gainfully employed.

subsection.heading: Dollar limit on amount creditable
subsection.content: The amount of the employment-related expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be taken into account under subsection (a) shall not exceed $3,000 for 1 qualifying individual, or $6,000 for 2 or more qualifying individuals.

section.heading: Credit for the elderly and the permanently and totally disabled

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: In the case of a qualified individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to 15 percent of such individual's section 22 amount for such taxable year.

subsection.heading: Qualified individual
subsection.content: For purposes of this section, the term "qualified individual" means any individual who has attained age 65 before the close of the taxable year, or who retired on disability before the close of the taxable year.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter the amount of the qualified adoption expenses paid or incurred by the taxpayer.

paragraph.heading: Dollar limitation
paragraph.content: The aggregate amount of qualified adoption expenses which may be taken into account under subsection (a) with respect to the adoption of a child shall not exceed $14,890.

paragraph.heading: Income limitation
paragraph.content: The amount allowable as a credit under subsection (a) for any taxable year shall be reduced (but not below zero) by an amount which bears the same ratio to the amount so allowable as provided in section 23(b)(2)(A).

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year with respect to each qualifying child of the taxpayer for which the taxpayer is allowed a deduction under section 151 an amount equal to $2,000 per qualifying child.

subsection.heading: Limitation based on adjusted gross income
subsection.content: The amount of the credit allowable under subsection (a) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by $50 for each $1,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds the threshold amount.

subsection.heading: Qualifying child
subsection.content: For purposes of this section, the term "qualifying child" means a qualifying child of the taxpayer (as defined in section 152(c)) who has not attained age 17.

subsection.heading: Portion of credit refundable
subsection.content: The aggregate credits allowed to a taxpayer under subpart C shall be increased by the lesser of the credit which would be allowed under this section without regard to this subsection and the limitation under section 26(a) or 15 percent of so much of the taxpayer's earned income as exceeds $2,500.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: There shall be allowed to an individual as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the product of the certificate credit rate with respect to any mortgage credit certificate held by such individual and the interest paid or accrued by the taxpayer during the taxable year on the remaining principal of the certified indebtedness amount, subject to the limitations under section 25(c).

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year the amount equal to the sum of the American Opportunity Tax Credit and the Lifetime Learning Credit.

subsection.heading: American Opportunity Tax Credit
subsection.content: In the case of any eligible student for whom an election is in effect under this section, the American Opportunity Tax Credit is an amount equal to the sum of 100 percent of so much of the qualified tuition and related expenses paid by the taxpayer during the taxable year (for education furnished to the eligible student during any academic period beginning in such taxable year) as does not exceed $2,000, plus 25 percent of such expenses so paid as exceeds $2,000 but does not exceed $4,000.

section.heading: Elective deferrals and IRA contributions by certain individuals

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of so much of the qualified retirement savings contributions of the eligible individual for the taxable year as do not exceed $2,000.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to 30 percent of the sum of the amounts paid or incurred by the taxpayer during such taxable year for qualified energy efficiency improvements.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of the sum of the qualified solar electric property expenditures, qualified solar water heating property expenditures, qualified fuel cell property expenditures, qualified small wind energy property expenditures, and qualified battery storage technology expenditures.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of a qualified buyer who during a taxable year places in service a previously-owned clean vehicle, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the lesser of $4,000 or the amount equal to 30 percent of the sale price.

section.heading: Limitation based on tax liability; definition of tax liability

subsection.heading: Limitation based on amount of tax
subsection.content: The aggregate amount of credits allowed by this subpart for the taxable year shall not exceed the excess (if any) of the taxpayer's regular tax liability for the taxable year over the tentative minimum tax for the taxable year (determined without regard to the alternative minimum tax foreign tax credit).

subsection.heading: Regular tax liability
subsection.content: For purposes of this part, the term "regular tax liability" means the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year reduced by the foreign tax credit allowable under section 27(a), the section 936 credit allowable under section 27(b), and the Puerto Rico economic activity credit under section 30A.

section.heading: Taxes of foreign countries and possessions of the United States; possession tax credit

subsection.heading: Foreign tax credit
subsection.content: The amount of taxes imposed by foreign countries and possessions of the United States shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter to the extent provided in section 901.

subsection.heading: Section 936 credit
subsection.content: The amount of the section 936 credit allowable under section 936 shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter to the extent provided in such section.

section.heading: Certain plug-in electric vehicles
section.content: [Repealed. Pub. L. 113-295, div. A, title II, Sec. 221(a)(28), Dec. 19, 2014, 128 Stat. 4040]

section.heading: Puerto Rico economic activity credit
section.content: [Repealed effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013, except as provided in section 936(j)]

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the sum of the new qualified fuel cell motor vehicle credit, the new advanced lean burn technology motor vehicle credit, the new qualified hybrid motor vehicle credit, and the new qualified alternative fuel motor vehicle credit.

section.heading: Alternative fuel vehicle refueling property credit

subsection.heading: Credit allowed
subsection.content: There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to 30 percent of the cost of any qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling property placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the sum of the credit amounts determined under subsection (b) with respect to each new clean vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

subsection.heading: Credit amount
subsection.content: For purposes of subsection (a), the credit amount determined under this subsection with respect to any new clean vehicle is the sum of $3,750 if such vehicle meets the critical mineral requirement, plus $3,750 if such vehicle meets the battery component requirement, as described in section 30D(e).

subsection.heading: Wage withholding for income tax purposes
subsection.content: The amount withheld as tax under chapter 24 shall be allowed to the recipient of the income as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle.

subsection.heading: Allowance of credit
subsection.content: In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the credit percentage of so much of the taxpayer's earned income for the taxable year as does not exceed the earned income amount.

subsection.heading: Percentages and amounts
subsection.content: For purposes of subsection (a), the credit percentage and the phaseout percentage shall be determined by reference to the number of qualifying children, as provided in section 32(b)(1).

paragraph.heading: Eligible individual
paragraph.content: The term "eligible individual" means any individual who has a qualifying child for the taxable year, or meets the age requirements of section 32(c)(1)(A)(ii).

paragraph.heading: Earned income
paragraph.content: The term "earned income" means wages, salaries, tips, and other employee compensation, but only if such amounts are includible in gross income for the taxable year, plus the amount of the taxpayer's net earnings from self-employment.

section.heading: Tax withheld at source on nonresident aliens and foreign corporations

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: The amount of tax withheld under chapter 3 (other than taxes withheld under section 1446 or 1446A) shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle to the extent of such tax.

section.heading: Certain uses of gasoline and special fuels

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the sum of the amounts payable to the taxpayer under section 6420 (relating to amounts paid in respect of gasoline used on farms), under section 6421 (relating to amounts paid in respect of gasoline used for certain nonhighway purposes), and under section 6427 (relating to fuels not used for taxable purposes).

section.heading: Health insurance costs of eligible individuals

subsection.heading: In general
subsection.content: In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to 72.5 percent of the amount paid by the taxpayer for coverage of the taxpayer and qualifying family members under qualified health insurance for eligible coverage months beginning in the taxable year.

section.heading: First-time homebuyer credit
section.content: [Expired. This section applied to purchases of principal residences before May 1, 2010]

section.heading: Making work pay credit
section.content: [Repealed. Pub. L. 111-312, title I, Sec. 101(b), Dec. 17, 2010, 124 Stat. 3298]

section.heading: Refundable credit for coverage under a qualified health plan

subsection.heading: In general
subsection.content: In the case of an applicable taxpayer, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for any taxable year an amount equal to the premium assistance credit amount of the taxpayer for the taxable year.

subsection.heading: Premium assistance credit amount
subsection.content: For purposes of this section, the premium assistance credit amount of the taxpayer for any taxable year is the sum of the premium assistance amounts determined under subsection (b)(2) with respect to all coverage months of the taxpayer occurring during the taxable year.

section.heading: Child tax credit
section.content: For child tax credit, see section 24, redesignated by the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 as section 36C for refundable portion treatment under certain circumstances.

subsection.heading: Credit allowed
subsection.content: The credit for overpayments of tax shall be treated as allowed under subpart C of part IV of this subchapter to the extent provided in section 6401.

part.heading: Definition of Gross Income, Adjusted Gross Income, Taxable Income, Etc.

subsection.heading: General definition
subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, gross income means all income from whatever source derived, including (but not limited to) the following items: (1) Compensation for services, including fees, commissions, fringe benefits, and similar items; (2) Gross income derived from business; (3) Gains derived from dealings in property; (4) Interest; (5) Rents; (6) Royalties; (7) Dividends; (8) Annuities; (9) Income from life insurance and endowment contracts; (10) Pensions; (11) Income from discharge of indebtedness; (12) Distributive share of partnership gross income; (13) Income in respect of a decedent; and (14) Income from an interest in an estate or trust.

subsection.heading: Cross references
subsection.content: For items specifically included in gross income, see part II (sec. 71 and following). For items specifically excluded from gross income, see part III (sec. 101 and following).

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: For purposes of this subtitle, the term "adjusted gross income" means, in the case of an individual, gross income minus the following deductions: (1) Trade and business deductions as provided in section 162; (2) Certain trade and business deductions of employees as provided in section 162(a) for reimbursed expenses; (3) Losses from sale or exchange of property; (4) Deductions attributable to rents and royalties; (5) Certain deductions of life tenants and income beneficiaries of property; (6) Pension, profit-sharing, and annuity plans of self-employed individuals as provided in sections 404 and 219; and (7) Retirement savings as provided in section 219.

subsection.heading: In general
subsection.content: Except as provided in subsection (b), for purposes of this subtitle, the term "taxable income" means gross income minus the deductions allowed by this chapter (other than the standard deduction).

subsection.heading: Individuals who do not itemize their deductions
subsection.content: In the case of an individual who does not elect to itemize his deductions for the taxable year, for purposes of this subtitle, taxable income means adjusted gross income minus the standard deduction and the deduction for personal exemptions provided in section 151.

paragraph.heading: In general
paragraph.content: For purposes of this subtitle, the term "standard deduction" means the sum of the basic standard deduction and the additional standard deduction.

paragraph.heading: Basic standard deduction
paragraph.content: For purposes of paragraph (1), the basic standard deduction is $12,950 in the case of a joint return or a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)), $9,600 in the case of a head of household (as defined in section 2(b)), or $6,475 in the case of an individual who is not married and who is not a surviving spouse or head of household.

section.heading: Ordinary income defined
section.content: For purposes of this subtitle, the term "ordinary income" includes any gain from the sale or exchange of property which is neither a capital asset nor property described in section 1231(b).

section.heading: Ordinary loss defined
section.content: For purposes of this subtitle, the term "ordinary loss" includes any loss from the sale or exchange of property which is not a capital asset. Any loss from the sale or exchange of property which is treated as ordinary loss under section 1231 shall be treated as a loss from the sale or exchange of property which is not a capital asset.

subsection.heading: Treatment of community income where spouses live apart
subsection.content: If (1) 2 individuals are married to each other at any time during a calendar year; (2) such individuals live apart at all times during the calendar year; (3) do not file a joint return under section 6013 with each other for a taxable year beginning or ending in the calendar year; and (4) one or both have earned income for the calendar year that is community income; then, for purposes of this title, any community income of such individuals for the calendar year shall be treated in accordance with the rules provided in subsection (a).

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: In the case of an individual, the miscellaneous itemized deductions for any taxable year shall be allowed only to the extent that the aggregate of such deductions exceeds 2 percent of adjusted gross income.

subsection.heading: Miscellaneous itemized deductions
subsection.content: For purposes of this section, the term "miscellaneous itemized deductions" means the itemized deductions other than (1) the deduction under section 163 (relating to interest); (2) the deduction under section 164 (relating to taxes); (3) the deduction under section 165(a) for casualty losses; (4) the deductions under section 170 (relating to charitable contributions); (5) the deduction under section 213 (relating to medical expenses); and others specifically enumerated in subsection (b).

subsection.heading: General rule
subsection.content: In the case of an individual whose adjusted gross income exceeds the applicable amount, the amount of the itemized deductions otherwise allowable for the taxable year shall be reduced by the lesser of (1) 3 percent of the excess of adjusted gross income over the applicable amount, or (2) 80 percent of the amount of the itemized deductions otherwise allowable for such taxable year.
